etymology.description: semantic: 白 ("flame") + phonetic: 王; originally a lit oil lamp.
etymology.interpretation: Early forms depicted a lit oil lamp, associating the graph with brightness and radiance. In later scripts, 白 contributes the idea of flame/brightness, while 王 supplies the sound and ties the word to notions of regal authority, yielding the imperial sense; the derivative 煌 preserves the original 'bright, shining' meaning.

examples.chinese: 他被册封为皇帝(他被冊封為皇帝)。
皇室的礼仪非常庄严(皇室的禮儀非常莊嚴)。
examples.english: The royal rituals are very solemn.

examples.chinese: 皇宫对公众开放(皇宮對公眾開放)。
examples.english: The imperial palace is open to the public.
